metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16642 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In PHP before 5.6.32, 7.x before 7.0.25, and 7.1.x before 7.1.11, an error in the date extension's timelib_meridian handling of 'front of' and 'back of' directives could be used by attackers able to supply date strings to leak information from the interpreter, related to ext/date/lib/parse_date.c out-of-bounds reads affecting the php_parse_date function. NOTE: this is a different issue than CVE-2017-11145.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23

php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23

php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23

php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23

php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> following debian comments, precise is not affected.

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.23').
